title: ENGLISH GRAMMAR - Present Perfect
description: Dit is een leerarrangement voor het grammatica onderwerp: Present perfect voor leerlingen in het VO.

items.content:
Welcome to the English Grammar Tenses- Present Perfect website!

In the following weeks, we will be learning everything about the present perfect tense.
On this website, you will get information about why and how we use this tense. After that, you get to practice with it on your own. At the end, when you have done everything to understand the present perfect fully, it is time to test it! Yes, every one of you will do the exam at the end (eindtoets).

So, what are our goals?

  1. At the end, you will understand when the present perfect is used,
  2. you will be able to remember how it is formed
  3. you will be able to apply the present perfect in the exercises and in the test.

Follow these steps:

  1. Read the goals at "Home" and come back.
  2. Watch the explanation video at "The Present perfect".
  3. Do the Padlet exercise at "Classroom wall".
  4. Do all of the practice exercises at "Practice".
  5. Do the "Practice test".
  6. Do you need more practice?

Yes > Go to "Extra" and practice more. After that, do the test at "The test".

No > Do the test at "The test".

You made it to the explanation page of the Present perfect!

Below, you can find a Youtube video that explains everything about the Present perfect tense. Before you start doing the exercises, practice test, and the end test, you must watch this video. Even if you think that you know the subject well enough, watch it again. Why? By rereading the materials about the past perfect, your brain will store the information better. That is the first step. After that, you can stimulate the storing process by doing exercises and doing the practice test. Soon enough, you will see that the test is easy as pie!

If you want to have access to the Prezi presentation, you can find it below the video.

If you have any questions, you can always put it on the Padlet classroom wall. I will answer all of your questions with a comment.

I wish you all good luck!

Ms. Tunc
The Prezi presentation. (click on the presentation title to go to the Prezi website)

<iframe id="iframe_container" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen="" mozallowfullscreen="" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" width="550" height="400" src="https://prezi.com/embed/ybs8hdzzwzgv/?bgcolor=ffffff&lock_to_path=0&autoplay=0&autohide_ctrls=0&landing_data=bHVZZmNaNDBIWnNjdEVENDRhZDFNZGNIUE43MHdLNWpsdFJLb2ZHanI0VDBLVHByMUJaSUkvZUJNdHZBUklqZDJnPT0&landing_sign=ZSIMv9zUfhzza4l8Bip3SvzC6Q-RY1QUdb4hZd_2eF8" name="iframe_container"/>

introduction.body: Since you have watched the video, you now should know when to use "have" and when to use "has". In this exercise, we will be practising that. Good luck!

prompt.body: Japanese ____ become one of the most popular courses in universities.
She ______ talked to several doctors about her weight.
My car ____ broken down three times already.

introduction.body: In this exercises, we will be practising the past participle of the verbs. As you know, we have regular and irregular verbs. This exercise helps you to improve your knowledge about them. Before you do the exercise, maybe it's clever to have a look at this "English irregular verb list". (Just click on it). After that, do the exercise. Good luck!

content.body: Jake and Ben already (to prepare) the birthday party.

Good job!
- "Jake and Ben" = they. "they" gets "have".
to prepare (voorbereiden) is a regular verb, thus gets -d (because prepare already ends with an 'e')
Good! To buy is an irregular verb.

Perfect! Jake = he. He, she and it gets 'has'.
The verb 'to choose' is an irregular verb, thus becomes 'chosen' in the past participle.
There are so many CDs, but Ben (not/ to listen) to them yet.
I already (to put) ten bottles into the fridge.
They (to make) lots of sandwiches so far.
Nice! to make is an irregular verb, thus becomes MADE in the past participle.
But she (not/ to put) the crisps on the table yet.
Good job. we put the word 'not' in between the verbs.
Jake never (to have) such a big birthday party.
Try it again. Have or has? Invite.. regular or irregular? Think....

prompt.body: Match the pictures to the right description. Good luck!

content.body: It has already made him ill.
She already has made the bed.
He explained to the host: "I have just fixed my car!"

prompt.body: Match the pictures to the right description.

content.body: "Happy anniversary! I have baked a cake for you!"
"you have been lucky.." the doctor said.
"I have seen my exam results and it makes me worry".
"I think I have bought the wrong ticket m'am".

1) I any racism. (never/experience)

2) We can start the interview, as all the candidates . (arrive)

3) I from Maurice. (hear)

4) The largest warehouse in Rotterdam down. (shut)

5) We will go outside as soon as the rain . (stop)

6) I think she it from your mother. (get)

7) Traveling in Europe great! (be)

8) I'm sorry! I all of the cookies. (eat)

9) They to buy her a bus ticket. (forget)

10) It so hard on the ground that it doesn't work anymore (fall)

questions.label: Put the verbs in present perfect tense.

items.content:
To do the practice test, click on "The practice test" below.

You need this code to enter te test: DAMFVCRA
